TEXT: CARDINAL . On TIME the applicant , who was unemployed at the time , went to ORG to look for new job offers . A considerable number of people , mainly women of GPE origin , had already gathered there and were waiting to enter ORG . The applicant , also of GPE origin , lined up at the back of the queue that had formed in front of the building .

CARDINAL . At TIME part of the group of persons burst into ORG . A police officer , who was there to enforce public order , managed to force them back outside . As the police officer was walking out of the building he was pushed by several women , who did not include the applicant . CARDINAL of those women indicated to the police officer that the applicant , still at the back of the queue , had pushed them .

CARDINAL . NORP The police officer approached the applicant and requested to see her identity documents . She refused and after a short , impolite verbal exchange the police officer instructed her to accompany him to the police station so as to perform an identity check . The applicant did not comply and the police officer tried to handcuff her . Shortly before the start of the hearing the applicant was requested to sign an assessment of an act of minor hooliganism ( акт за констатиране на дребно хулиганство : the “ assessment ” ) . The applicant alleged , which the Government challenged , that she did not have time to review the document . She signed the document without making any reservations . The applicant further alleged , which the Government did not expressly dispute , that she was not given a copy of the signed assessment .
CARDINAL . NORP The hearing began at TIME The applicant represented herself before ORG . She was charged with the administrative offence of minor hooliganism .

CARDINAL . The hearing started with the assessment being read out in court . It was claimed that the applicant ( CARDINAL ) had created a disturbance in front ORG by pushing the other women in the queue ; ( CARDINAL ) had acted disruptively in response to the police officer 's instructions and had resisted arrest ; and ( CARDINAL ) had slapped CARDINAL of the police officer 's in the face . When the applicant was asked whether she was aware of the assessment she responded as follows :

“ I am aware of it , actually I am not aware of the assessment of [ an act of minor hooliganism ] . Now that you read it out though , I understand what all of this is about , but it is not true , I have witnesses . ”
CARDINAL . The court proceeded to question the applicant , the QUANTITY police officers who arrested her and an official from ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicant refuted the accusations against her . She claimed that the police officers had dragged her to the police station and had kicked her repeatedly before placing her in a cell . She also claimed that she had never hit the police officer , but that he had injured himself on a tree during the arrest . On several occasions during the hearing the applicant claimed that she could summon witnesses who would corroborate her version of events . She also stated that she was unable to call witnesses for the hearing as she was not aware where the police officers were taking her when they placed her in the police car to take her to court .
CARDINAL . Both police officers testified that the applicant had acted disruptively and had hit CARDINAL of them .
CARDINAL . The official from ORG testified that she had seen the applicant lifting her hand , but had not seen her actually slap the police officer .
CARDINAL . The hearing ended at TIME

CARDINAL . After a short session in camera for deliberations , the ORG delivered its verdict . It found the applicant guilty of minor hooliganism and imposed an administrative sanction of DATE detention at the GPE police station effective as of TIME on DATE . The court fully credited the testimonies of the police officers and the official from ORG while it refused to accept that of the applicant , because she had made the statements in “ the context of her defence ” . The judgment was not subject to appeal and entered into force immediately .
CARDINAL . The applicant was then taken back to the GPE police station where she served her sentence .

CARDINAL . The Decree on Combating Minor Hooliganism ( the “ Decree ” ) was adopted in DATE . It envisages an expedited procedure for bringing to court minor offences of hooliganism which are punishable with an administrative sanction of DATE detention at a police station or a fine of CARDINAL NORP levs ( CARDINAL QUANTITY : section CARDINAL ) . The expedited procedure under the ORG provides that an “ assessment of an act of minor hooliganism ” ( акт за констатиране на дребно хулиганство ) is prepared by the police or competent municipal authorities . The document is then presented to the accused for signature who has the right to make any reservations he or she deems fit ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . NORP If judicial proceedings are to be initiated against the accused , the assessment , together with the colleted data , is to be filed with ORG immediately , or at the latest within TIME ( section CARDINAL ) . In turn , a ORG judge , sitting alone , holds a hearing in the presence of the accused and examines the case within a further TIME ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Witnesses are summoned at the discretion of the judge and the accused have the right to be represented by legal counsel ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . The resulting judgment of ORG judge is not subject to appeal and is to be executed immediately ( section CARDINAL ) . Prior to the amendments of DATE to ORG it was possible to file a petition for review of the judgments adopted under LAW by following the procedure envisaged in the said act ( PERSON решение № DATE от CARDINAL г. , ORG № CARDINAL г. , ORG ) . Following the amendments of DATE that was no longer possible . Similarly it was not possible to file a cassation appeal under the above mentioned act ( Определение № DATE от CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL г. по адм. д. № CARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , I отд. на ВАС ) .
